snippet: Consumers may face big payments to doctors who participate in their care, in an emergency or in a hospital, but are not in their insurance network.
abstract: Tara Siegel Bernard Your Money column warns that consumers can face enormous bills after unknowingly receiving out-of-network care at hospitals or in emergency rooms, even if they were sent there by in-network doctors; notes that while Affordable Care Act caps what consumers spend out of pocket with in-network providers, it provides no such protection for out-of-network care.
lead_paragraph: Consumers may face big payments to doctors who participate in their care, in an emergency or in a hospital, but are not in their insurance network.

headline.main: Out of Network, Not by Choice, and Facing Huge Health Bills
headline.print_headline: Out of Network, Not by Choice, and Facing Huge Health Bills

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
